org.dudss.nodeshot.buildings

Class AbstractBuilding

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dudss.nodeshot.buildings.AbstractBuilding
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Entity
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractGenerator, AlertableBuilding, ConveyorBuilding, Headquarters, NodeBuilding, PowerGenerator

    public abstract class AbstractBuilding
extends java.lang.Object
implements Entity
    The basic skeletal representation of a building. All buildings are subclasses of this abstract class.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      • AbstractBuilding

    • Method Detail

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(float cx,
                        float cy,
                        boolean snap)
        Sets all the necessary position attributes and sets up building chunks array at the specified position. This method does not check for building obstacles!.
        Parameters:
        cx - Building centre X coordinate.
        cy - Building centre Y coordinate.
        snap - Whether to snap the coordinates to the nearest Chunk.
        See Also:
        canBeBuiltAt(float, float, boolean)

      • canBeBuiltAt

        public boolean canBeBuiltAt(float cx,
                            float cy,
                            boolean snap)
        Method that checks whether a building can be built at this location. Should be called before setLocation(float, float, boolean). This method also takes terrain height into consideration.

      • setCoordinates

        protected void setCoordinates(float cx,
                              float cy,
                              boolean snap)
        Recalculates the building coordinates that apply for the following world-space cursor coordinates
        Parameters:
        cx - Building centre X coordinate.
        cy - Building centre Y coordinate.
        snap - Whether to snap the coordinates to the nearest Chunk.

      • getCoordinates

        public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 getCoordinates(float cx,
                                                    float cy,
                                                    boolean snap)
        Retrieves the coordinates that would apply for the following world-space cursor coordinates.
        Parameters:
        cx - Building centre X coordinate.
        cy - Building centre Y coordinate.
        snap - Whether to snap the coordinates to the nearest Chunk.

      • getPrefabVector

        public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 getPrefabVector(float cx,
                                                     float cy,
                                                     boolean snap)

      • update

        public void update()
        Building update method, updated by the SimulationThread. The default AbstractBuilding update method handles creeper damage, explosion and resource costs. So if a building extending this object calls super.update() within its update method, it will be harmed by the creeper.

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch)
        Draw method

      • drawPrefab

        public abstract void drawPrefab(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShapeRenderer r,
                                com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch,
                                float cx,
                                float cy,
                                boolean snap)
        Prefab draw method (prefab is the building representation following the cursor when in build mode)

      • build

        public void build()
        Called when the building is built. Registers it to its BuildingManager.

      • build

        public void build(boolean register)
        Called when the building is built.
        Parameters:
        register - Whether to register the building to its BuildingManager immediately.

      • register

        protected void register()
        Registers the building to a BuildingManager. Making it drawable and updateable. Some buildings need this to be called at the end of their build() methods.

        If a building needs to initialise some variables before starting its update cycle. You can call super.build(false) and then this.register at the end of the overriden build method.

      • buildAndLevel

        public void buildAndLevel(boolean register)
        Builds the building but flattens the terrain under the building first.
        Parameters:
        register - Whether to register the building to its BuildingManager immediately.

      • buildAndLevel

        public void buildAndLevel()
        Builds the building but flattens the terrain under the building first. The building is registered to its BuildingManager.

      • demolish

        public void demolish()
        Called upon demolition. Adds the building to a BuildingManager and updates fog of war.

      • explode

        public void explode()
        Called when demolished by force

      • outline

        public void outline(boolean outline)
        Flags the building as outlined/selected

      • updateFogOfWar

        protected void updateFogOfWar(boolean show)
        Updates the fog of war in a fogOfWarRadius.
        Parameters:
        show - When true, fog of war will be revealed, when false it will be deactivated.

      • getBuildingChunks

        public Chunk[] getBuildingChunks()
        All the Chunks this building is occupying

      • clearBuildingChunks

        public void clearBuildingChunks()
        Clears the building reference of all the buildingChunks

      • levelTerrainOfBuildingChunks

        public void levelTerrainOfBuildingChunks()
        Levels all the Chunks under this building (Makes them the same terrain height) based on surrounding values. Updates terrain accordingly.
